cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 345 mi W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northwest tonight, then northeast on Wednesday, crossing Florida’s Big Bend Thursday and accelerating northeastward off the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coasts into the open Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Gulf Coast between the Anclote River and Indian Pass (Big Bend area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anclote River to Indian Pass FL; Tropical Storm Watch west of Indian Pass to Walton/Bay County line FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast (Big Bend), then the coasts of GA, SC and NC as the system moves NE and offshore
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤3%) of tropical-storm-force gusts; breezy conditions possible late Friday–Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in Delaware River or upper Delaware Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer moisture plume could drop 1–2 inches of rain across the Philadelphia area Friday night into Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells and dangerous rip currents along New Jersey and Delaware beaches may disrupt pilot and lightering operations.
